lines.content: 6. Saving and loading of Tasks List tasks
Add a todo task that only has a description and no deadline
Add a deadline task that has a description and a deadline
Add an event task that has a description and an event date
Delete any task at free will
Find any task in your list currently
List all tasks you currently have
Mark your tasks as done when you are done with them
Your tasks are automatically saved and loaded everytime you leave and restart Duke
Start the Duke jar file and input the commands as shown below
Now you have 7 tasks in the list.`
Now you have 8 tasks in the list.`
Now you have 9 tasks in the list.`
`Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.`

* Creates a deadline task with details specified by user

* Converts all details of the task into one full string
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n    \u2713 " + taskings.get(itemDone - 1).getDescription());
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + taskings.get(itemNumber).toString() + "\nNow you have " + (itemNumber + 1) + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + taskings.get(itemNumber).toString() + "\nNow you have " + (itemNumber + 1) + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + taskings.get(itemNumber).toString() + "\nNow you have " + (itemNumber + 1) + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task: \n  " + taskings.get(taskNumber - 1).toString() + "\nNow you have " + (itemNumber - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
